column2: The [d_lindsey.GetHolderPeopleName] rulers of central Britain have created the '[d_lindsey.GetFullName]' in the lands that once formed the Principality of Linnius.\n\nFrom this day on, the provinces around the former provincial capital of Lindum will belong 'de jure' to the newly formed [d_lindsey.GetTitlePrefix]. Any previous claim or birthright will no longer be recognized, and the local Anglo-Saxon rulers will be considered the only rightful lieges of these lands.

The bravest and most loyal Anglo-Saxon lords from all over the forest of Arden have gathered outside our gates in [Root.Location.GetName] and sworn oaths of fealty to the kingdom of Mercia. Eager for the glory and riches of war, they will serve us with honor and will be known as the 'Spears of Mercia'.
Excellent. The path of glory awaits them.

The proclamation of the kingdom has led to a much reduced perception of Anglia's extent, and much of its former eastern lands are now considered to be part of the kingdom of Mercia.

The [e_aengland.GetAdjective] rulers of western Britain have declared the creation of the '[k_wales.GetFullName]'. Built on the ruins of some of the last Welsh kingdoms, the newly formed earldom claims sovereignty over all of the Cambrian Highlands, from the valleys of Glamorgan to the Isle of Anglesey.\n\nFrom this day on, these provinces will belong 'de jure' to the [k_wales.GetFullName]. Any previous claim or birthright will no longer be recognized, and the local [e_aengland.GetAdjective] rulers will be considered the only rightful lieges of these lands.

The dream of Hengist and Horsa has been fulfilled - through treachery, intermarriage, and conquest, the Kingdom of the Anglo-Saxons now rules over all of the old province of Britannia, from the German to the Irish Sea. Their fierce resistance undone by their eternal bane of division, the Britons are again a conquered people in their ancient homeland, chafing under the rule of their Germanic overlords.\n\nThe ambitions of the [e_aengland.GetAdjective] are unlikely to be satisfied with the conquest of Wales - already there are reports of [e_aengland.GetAdjective] scouts monitoring the Pictish border and exploring the Irish coasts. It may not be long before all of the British Isles and beyond fall under the Saxon yoke.
We will never abandon the land of our fathers!

Viking raiders have conquered and currently hold territory that makes up some of the southernmost border of the Pictish homeland, including the important port at Alt Clut, and have declared the creation of a new Jarldom, called Leifernax, that will belong only to the Norse and those that swear fealty to them!\n\n The new jarldom is now well protected by the fierce warriors of the Norse, and provides an outstanding harbor for the swift Viking ships to potentially raid Pictish and British towns and shrines...

Where in previous years, the Norse warlords in the isles to the north and west of Pictavia and Dal Riata have contented themselves with petty kingdoms conquered from the native Celts, the time has come for far greater control of the lands. The Norse under [Root.GetTitledName] have formally proclaimed themselves rulers of all the islands on the western coast, down to the southern island of Mon .\n\nAs more and more ships bring in farmers, warriors, and women, the names and customs of the people who formerly ruled these lands will fade into memory, as their sacred grounds fall to the mighty Norse gods!
The power of the Northmen grow ever stronger...

Where in previous years, the Norse warlords in the isles to the north and east of Pictavia have contented themselves with petty kingdoms conquered from the native Celts, the time has come for far greater control of the lands. The Norse under [Root.GetTitledName] have formally proclaimed themselves rulers of all the islands on the eastern coast closest to the Norse homeland, while also declaring 'de jure' possession of  a significant portion of the most northern section of the mainland .\n\nAs more and more ships bring in farmers, warriors, and women, the names and customs of the people who formerly ruled these lands will fade into memory, as their sacred grounds fall to the mighty Norse gods!
The power of the Northmen grow ever stronger...

After successfully uniting the lands of Ireland under his rule, [Root.GetFullName] has proclaimed himself worthy of the sacral title of High King of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. His vassals have recognized his sovereign lordship and crowned him High King in the Great Hall of [Root.Location.GetName].\n\nApparently, the Christian Church is well disposed to the idea of a stronger political authority in Ireland. Its clerics have been developing the theory of a high kingship and writing tracts exhorting kings to rule rather than reign.
Excellent! In the name of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName], I am High King.

After successfully uniting the vast and cold highlands of the north under his rule, [Root.GetFullName] has proclaimed himself 'High King of Alba', uniting Picts, Gaels, Cumbrians, and Anglo-Saxons alike into a single unified kingdom stretching from the highlands at the northern tip of Britannia to the Cumbric lowlands south of the Antonine Wall. His vassals have recognized his sovereign lordship and crowned him High King in the Great Hall of [Root.Location.GetName].\n\nEven when divided, the fierce warriors of the highlands were renowned for their ferocity and power and thought impossible to subjugate. With the entirety of the North now united under a single ruler at last, will anybody be able to truly challenge their power?

In the northern provinces of Britain, the ancient Cumbric kingdom of the Old North, also known as 'Yr Hen Ogledd', has been formed once more under the rule of [Root.GetFullName]. His vassals have recognized his sovereign lordship and crowned him High King in the Great Hall of [Root.Location.GetName].\n\nWhile it is said that the Anglo-Saxons of the South are steel, the Men of the North are stone. The true Kings of the North were prophesied to regain their dominion and expand their rule over all of the British Isles. Will the unified Cumbric North be able to repel the Germanic invaders from Britain once and for all?
I am High King of the Old North.

With the fall of the east to the Anglo-Saxon invaders, the Britons fled west, eventually being pushed into the hills and valleys of Cymru. Now, [Root.GetFullName] has succeeded in uniting the squabbling petty kingdoms of the Britons under his rule and has been crowned High King of Cymru in the Great Hall of [Root.Location.GetName]. \n\nWhile the Anglo-Saxons conquered a Lloegyr divided into squabbling petty kingdoms, the Britons of Cymru have now been unified into one. Will the Britons have their revenge and drive the Germanic invaders back into the sea?
I am High King of the Britons.

In the far northwest of Gaul, [Root.GetFullName] has managed to unite the principalities of the Armorican pennisula under his rule and conquer vast territories beyond into the heart of what was once known as Armorica. Now, his vassals have recognized his sovereign lordship, no longer a mere king among many, and crowned him High King in the Great Hall of [Root.Location.GetName]. \n\nWhile province after province fell to the barbarian invaders, Armorica stood as a bastion for Romans and Celts alike, successfully resisting every attempt to truly subjugate the pennisula. Will a unified Armorica be strong enough to resist the predations of the Germanic invaders and restore Celtic dominance over Gaul?

After unifying much of Gaul under [Root.GetHerHis] rule, [Root.GetTitledName] has had himself crowned Imperator and declared the restoration of the Empire in the west! The newly restored empire claims authority over all of the former Roman Gaul, and [Root.GetTitledName] has decreed the restoration of the old Roman provinces of the area over the claims of the obsolete Germanic tribal kingdoms.\n\nWhile his claim to the Empire has been decried by many Romans asserting that no barbarian could ever be emperor, few in the realm openly challenge his legitimacy.  Only one question remains - will the new empire be content with what it has achieved, or will these Romanized "barbarian" emperors only stop like the Romans before them when they have "made a desert and call it peace"?
No barbarian could truly be emperor...

From the mountains of the Pyrenees to the plains of Novempopulania, [Root.GetFullName] has managed to unite all the old Aquitani lands and has pushed beyond into the great Romano-Gallic cities of the Garumna. Now, his vassals have recognized his sovereign lordship and crowned him High King in the Great Hall of [Root.Location.GetName]. \n\nWhile the rest of Gaul adopted the culture of the Romans and the rule of the Germans, only the tribes of the Vasconians kept their language and way of life, resisting all foreign attempts at subjugation. With centuries of tenacity in its blood, will an ascendant Akitania ever be truly defeated?

In the Isles of the Danes and the neighbouring lands, [Root.GetFullName] has managed to defeat his fellow petty kings and unify the land under [Root.GetHerHis] rule, as the great king Dan once did. Now, he has had himself crowned "High Kingdom of Denmark" in the Great Mead Hall of [From.Capital.GetName], claiming authority over all of the three lands of Jutland, Sjaelland, and Skane.\n\nNot to be satisfied with [From.GetHerHis] current domain, [From.GetTitledName] is already planning [From.GetHerHis] future conquests - looking south into Germania, west across the North Sea, and north into the fellow Norse kingdoms. Only time will tell who will be the first to suffer the wrath of the fierce and merciless Danish warriors descending on their realm.
I am High King of the Danes.

Having triumphed over the other petty kings of northern Scandinavia, [Root.GetFullName] has managed to unify the rugged fjords and ripuarian valleys of the Scandes and had himself crowned "High King of Norway" in the Great Mead Hall of [From.Capital.GetName], claiming sovereignty from the coasts of the Skaggerak to Trondelag and beyond.\n\nWhile ambitious Norse lords and kings have always looked eagerly over the North Sea for new lands to plunder and conquer, this new kingdom unites the proud navigators and shipbuilders of the Norwegian coast like never before. Only time will tell where the unified Norwegian kingdom will strike next.
I am High King of the Norwegians.

In the snowy forests of Geatland, [Root.GetFullName] has managed to triumph over [Root.GetHerHis] fellow chiefs and unify the many petty kingdoms of the Geats under his rule. Now, his vassals have recognized his sovereign lordship and crowned him High King of all the Geats in the Great Mead Hall of [Root.Location.GetName].\n\nThe fierce name of the Geats and Goths once struck fear into the hearts men across Europe and beyond. Will the newly unified kingdom of the Geats live up to their much-vaunted reputation and usher in a new age of Geatish rule and glory?
I am High King of the Geats.

In the distant northeast of Scandinavia, [Root.GetFullName] has managed to subjugate [Root.GetHerHis] rival chieftains and stands unchallenged among the petty kings of the Swedes. Now, his vassals have recognized his sovereign lordship and crowned him High King of all the Swedes in the Great Mead Hall of [Root.Location.GetName].\n\nThe ambitious Swedes now look south into lands of the Geats and east out into the Mare Suebicum and beyond, eagerly searching for new lands to explore, plunder, and conquer. Will the new united Swedish kingdom extend its power throughout Scandinavia and beyond?
I am High King of the Swedes.

Long have the fierce Norse warriors been divided into innumerable petty tribes and kingdoms, with many great kings rising above the fray only to have their realm dismembered upon their deaths. But now, against all odds, [Root.GetFullName] has managed to unite all the four nations under [Root.GetHerHis] rule and in a great ceremony has been crowned "High King of the Norse" in the Great Mead Hall of [Root.Location.GetName].\n\nEven when divided, the Norse were feared throughout the known world for their fierce warriors and legendary seafarers. Does this spell a great new age of Norse supremacy over Europe? Or is this union of Danes, Norwegians, Geats and Swedes fated to fail and collapse, torn between the tensions and rivalries of its constituent nations?
The Age of the Norse begins!

[Root.GetTitledName] has done what many believed to be impossible - against all odds, [Root.GetSheHe] has managed to unite all of the disparate tribes of Magna Germania under his banner, from the marshes of the German Sea to the forests of the Rhenus and Danubius and beyond.\n\nNow titling himself "High King of the Germans", [Root.GetTitledName] has implicitly laid claim to the various Germanic tribes and kingdoms of Scandinavia, Ænglaland, and the former Roman Empire - with the armies of some of the fiercest warriors in the known world to back his words up. Does this herald a new era of Germanic domination across Western Europe? Or will this vast new confederation collapse into tribal infighting once more, unable to hold together the disparate wills of its constituent peoples?
The Age of the Germans has begun!
We will not bow before his pretentions!
